Given that you're interested in an espionage story, I would highly recommend "Mr. & Mrs. Smith". This action-packed film stars Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt as a married couple who discover they're both secret agents with a shared target. It offers a thrilling blend of romance and high-stakes spy games!

If you're open to exploring something a bit more lighthearted, "The Trouble with Harry" might be right up your alley. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock and starring John Forsythe, this film tells the story of a man who dies in a local woods, causing quite a commotion as everyone tries to figure out what happened to him. It's both funny and intriguing!

Given your interest in espionage and intrigue, I'd recommend you watch "The Wraith" (1986). This action-packed movie features a mysterious character who targets a local violent gang with the help of a supernatural sports car. It might not be directly related to the Smith duo, but it definitely fits your preference for suspense and mystery!

If you're up for a more modern twist, "You" (2014) is another psychological thriller that explores themes of obsession and manipulation in a compelling way. The plot revolves around the question of what happens when the right to bear arms is abused, making it a thought-provoking watch. Enjoy!

Based on your preference for a Swedish language movie, I'd recommend "Let the Right One In" (Swedish title: "Låt den rätte komma in"). This is a unique blend of drama and horror that tells the story of a young boy and a mysterious girl who moves into his apartment complex. It's a thought-provoking film with some chilling moments, and it stars Kare Hedebrant and Lina Leandersson.

Another interesting Swedish movie is "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" (Swedish title: "Män som hatar kvinnor"), directed by Niels Arden Oplev. It's a crime thriller about a journalist and a computer hacker who team up to solve a forty-year-old mystery involving a wealthy industrialist's missing granddaughter. The film stars Michael Nyqvist and Noomi Rapace, and it was later remade in English.

I'd highly recommend "Silent Running" for you, especially since you mentioned an interest in adventure films. This movie takes place in a future where Earth's flora is extinct and follows an astronaut who protects the last of Earth's botany aboard a spacecraft. It stars Bruce Dern and features beautiful visual effects for its time.

Another interesting choice would be "Hook", starring Robin Williams as an adult Peter Pan who must return to Neverland to reclaim his youthful spirit and save his children from Captain Hook. Both films offer unique twists on classic themes and are great additions to the adventure genre. Enjoy your viewing!
